alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 8:37AM EDT until April 19 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River At Smithfield. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. At 18.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. The Smithfield town park and the Neuse Riverwalk at the US70 bridge are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 16.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Wed Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 14.4 Sat 8 am EDT 16.6 15.9 15.2 14.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening by 845 PM EDT.
